item.title: Sotheby's CEO sees 'very strong demand' ahead of $1.4 billion art auctions
item.description: The fall auction sales in New York next week are expected to top $1.4 billion, marking a 50% increase from last year, according to art experts.

item.title: $1 trillion test for the art market: Here's what to know
item.description: The art market hopes to get out of bear territory with a big week of auctions, including a golden ticket. CNBC's Robert Frank joins 'Squawk Box' with ...

item.title: Prada says Milan listing still on the table — but won’t commit until timing is ‘six months away’
item.description: Prada CFO Andrea Bonini sat down with CNBC's Charlotte Reed to chat also Miu Miu, the Chinese and U.S. markets, and succession plans.

item.title: Fall art auction sales estimated to increase 58% from last year
item.description: CNBC's Robert Frank joins 'Money Movers' from the brand new Sotheby's headquarters.

item.title: Millionaires value their personal trainers and therapists more than their wealth advisors
item.description: The trend highlight the growing importance of so-called "soft services" for the wealthy.
